message.content:
cs.DL, cs.SI, cs.IR, cs.CY, cs.CL 

The paper discusses the organization and productivity of research specialisms, with a focus on humanities and science specialisms. The paper proposes an operationalization of the rural and urban analogy and tests the hypothesis that humanities specialisms are rural while science specialisms are urban. The paper also discusses the differences in citation and textual connectivity between rural and urban specialisms. Based on this, the most likely arXiv CS sub-categories for this paper are cs.DL (Digital Libraries), cs.SI (Social and Information Networks), cs.IR (Information Retrieval), cs.CY (Computers and Society), and cs.CL (Computation and Language).
